fields.description:
I noticed this test failed consistently since yesterday. The first failed jenkins job is https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-common-trunk-Java8/723/changes, and from the change log:

{noformat}
Changes:

[wheat9] HDFS-9402. Switch DataNode.LOG to use slf4j. Contributed by Walter Su.

[wheat9] HADOOP-11218. Add TLSv1.1,TLSv1.2 to KMS, HttpFS, SSLFactory.

[wheat9] HADOOP-12467. Respect user-defined JAVA_LIBRARY_PATH in Windows Hadoop

[wheat9] HDFS-8914. Document HA support in the HDFS HdfsDesign.md. Contributed by

[wheat9] HDFS-9153. Pretty-format the output for DFSIO. Contributed by Kai Zheng.

[wheat9] HDFS-7796. Include X-editable for slick contenteditable fields in the

[wheat9] HDFS-3302. Review and improve HDFS trash documentation. Contributed by

[wheat9] HADOOP-12294. Remove the support of the deprecated dfs.umask.
{noformat}

HADOOP-12294 looks to be the most likely cause.
fields.summary: Clean up depreated umasks and related unit tests

comments.body: From the description of HADOOP-12294, the behavior tested by the test case was already deprecated. After HADOOP-12294, the deprecated behavior was removed and therefore this test case should be removed as well.

Hi [~wheat9] [~zxu] [~jlowe] [~lichangleo],
I would like to ask for your comments on this issue, because you have previously discussed in HADOOP-12294. I want to make sure that my understanding about the patch for HADOOP-12294 is correct, that the test case should be removed.

Thank you.

This message was automatically generated.

Thanks [~jojochuang] for working on this! The test changes are correct since we decide to remove the use of deprecated old umask key in {{getUMask}} in HADOOP-12294. 
The failed unit tests are not related. {{TestDecayRpcScheduler}} is flaky.
 If possible could you also help remove the line {code} int oldUmask = conf.getInt(DEPRECATED_UMASK_LABEL, Integer.MIN_VALUE); {code} in {{getUMask}} ?
Otherwise, +1(non-binding) on the latest patch

Hi [~lichangleo] thanks for the review.
Is the intention remove DEPRECATED_UMASK_LABEL entirely?
Other than this, DEPRECATED_UMASK_LABEL is also being used in two other places in FsPermission.java and TestPermission.java
Hi [~jojochuang], though it could be removed entirely for 3.0, but the scope of HADOOP-12294 only intends to remove it from {{getUMask}}
Thanks [~lichangleo] for the explanation. Agree to take a minimalist approach. Rev03 is Rev02 with the unused variable removed.
I've asked for some clarification on HADOOP-12294 about what that patch was trying to achieve, and I asked that we consider reverting it.  Please see my comment in HADOOP-12294 for more details.

[~wheat9], I have opened HADOOP-12595 to track the whole work of remove deprecated dfs.umask, how about let me do the cleanup work there. If {code}public static final String DEPRECATED_UMASK_LABEL = "dfs.umask";{code} is removed, 
{code}conf.setInt(DEPRECATED_UMASK_LABEL, umask.toShort());{code} also needs to be removed in {{setUMask}}

[~wheat9], I have opened HADOOP-12595 to track the whole work of remove deprecated dfs.umask, how about let me do the cleanup work there. If {code}public static final String DEPRECATED_UMASK_LABEL = "dfs.umask";{code} is removed, 
{code}conf.setInt(DEPRECATED_UMASK_LABEL, umask.toShort());{code} also needs to be removed in {{setUMask}}
It makes sense to remove it from {{setUMask}} as well since it is a deprecated functionality, and it is only used to pass umask internally.

I am thinking to remove all usages of DEPRECATED_UMASK_LABEL in tests in the next revision, before HADOOP-12595 is committed. Otherwise removing DEPRECATED_UMASK_LABEL in HADOOP-12595 will make it unable to build.
Since this jira only intends to fix test,  it's better to avoid touching src code. Prefer to let HADOOP-12595 to remove all reference of DEPRECATED_UMASK_LABEL.
The issue is trivial enough thus I see little values of having multiple jiras on fixing the same issue. Let's combine the effort and use one jira to address it here.
Well... then let's do what [~wheat9] said, to totally remove the support of the deprecated dfs.umask here

testSetTimesSymlinkToDir had failed before so likely flaky.
